key_insight: A panoramic metric depth foundation model trained on a large, mixed dataset (public + synthetic UE5 + text-to-image + web panoramas) with a three-stage pseudo-labeling/data-in-the-loop strategy achieves robust, metric depth estimation across diverse scene distances and domains.
problem_solved: Existing depth models struggle to produce accurate, metric depth for full 360Â° panoramas across both near and far scene distances and suffer from domain gaps between indoor/outdoor and synthetic/real data.
method: Data-in-the-loop construction: combine public datasets, high-quality UE5 synthetic panoramas, text-to-image generated scenes, and real web panoramas to build a large and diverse training corpus.
Three-stage pseudo-labeling pipeline: progressively generate and refine pseudo depth supervision to reduce domain gaps between indoor/outdoor and synthetic/real sources.
Train a panoramic metric depth foundation model on the curated mixed data to generalize depth prediction across scales and domains.
impact: Provides practitioners a scalable approach to obtain reliable metric depth from panoramas for applications like AR/VR, robotics, mapping and 3D scene understanding; reduces reliance on scarce real panoramic depth annotations.

paper_title: Depth Any Panoramas: A Foundation Model for Panoramic Depth Estimation
paper_authors: Xin Lin, Meixi Song, Dizhe Zhang, Wenxuan Lu, Haodong Li
